meanings.definition: A soldier or guard stationed to keep watch or to control access to a place.
meanings.sent1: The sentinels stood at the entrance, vigilant and alert.
meanings.sent2: The ancient castle was protected by stone sentinels along the walls.
meanings.sent3: The sentinels at the gate were so focused that they didn't even notice the squirrel stealing their snacks.
meanings.sent4: As the sun set, the mountains became dark silhouettes, resembling sentinels guarding the valley.
meanings.sent5: The image of the sentinels overlooking the city was etched in his memory.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that watches or stands as if watching.
meanings.sent1: The tall trees in the forest acted as natural sentinels, keeping an eye on all who passed by.
meanings.sent2: The lighthouse on the cliff served as a reliable sentinel for ships navigating the rocky coast.
meanings.sent3: The fluffy white clouds in the sky seemed like friendly sentinels observing the world below.
meanings.sent4: Her loyal dog sat by the window like a faithful sentinel, watching for her return.
meanings.sent5: The old scarecrow in the field stood like a silent sentinel, guarding the crops from birds.
